column4: Right. I've been playing a bit with compiz and Unity, now I'm trying to figure something out. How do I change _desktops_?
I can change viewports on the one desktop, and I can throw programs onto other desktops, what I can't seem to do is to change what desktop I'm currently on.
ck+lick on desktop on taskbar and yu will see all your desktops selet witch one you want
hm?
read http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1742326
I'll look that up, just as soon as I can figure out how the @)%(*@% to get my Chrome and Firefox back into THIS desktop
by the way, what's ck-lick?
And there's no "desktop on taskbar" icon that I can see.
typing mistake click is right word
where's this "desktop" icon?
hm. That's weird. I now have a blue triangle on my start icon...
I'm not at ubuntu right now but I'm sure is there because I didn't add it
I read about this, but I can't get back to my browser.
try to launch it from applicvations
*applications
uhm, launch what?
lat folder on bar>applications>internet> your browser of choice
yeah, THAT works, but I'm trying to go fetch my PREVIOUSLY started chrome...
*last or at the bottom maybe is better
!fr | mikael
with other browser go to the link I posted you and there is many things you want to know about unity
